serial_manager module

! @brief Functions for serial comminication with MCU.

This file contains functions for communicating over a serial usb/bluetooth link using tcp/ip sockets.

-> Each sensor page can import relevant functions for efficiency. -> Keeping all in one place in case of changes to how I communicate with sensors.

By sending data back and forth:

-> Data can be requested from sensors -> Sensor-specific settings can be changed -> Microcontroller operations can be changed (e.g., sleep mode) -> Both of the above involves sending specific mappings from mappings.py

serial_manager.get_battery()
Dictionary keys:

[‘volt’, ‘pct’, ‘temp’]

serial_manager.get_gps()
Dictionary keys:

[‘lat’, ‘lng’, ‘alt’, ‘spd’, ‘sat’]

Dictionary keys:

[‘X’,’Y’,’Z’]

[‘X’,’Y’,’Z’]

[‘X’,’Y’,’Z’]

serial_manager.get_multimeter()

! Get readings from current sensor INA219 @warning This works differently from others. @return if normal -> current, voltage, power @return if error -> -1, -1, -1

Dictionary keys:

[‘noise_out’]

Dictionary keys:

[‘03um’, ‘05um’, ‘10um’, ‘25um’, ‘50um’, ‘100um’]

Dictionary keys:

[‘pressure’, ‘bmp_temp’, ‘p_over’, ‘t_over’, ‘alt’]

serial_manager.get_radiation()
Dictionary keys:

[‘CPM’]

serial_manager.get_serial_vals(send_msg, dict_names_list)

! @brief Main function actually responsible for serial communication msg send/recv. @param send_msg Message (i.e., code) to be sent. @param dict_names_list Sensor specific names for returned name/value pairs. @returns Dictionary with name-value pairs specified in dict_names_list.

@note This is a note

serial_manager.get_wind()

! Read analog value from wind sensor. @warning This works differently from others. @return if normal -> wind_val @return if error -> -1

! Dump serial vals

serial_manager.set_geiger_power_off()

! Disconnect power to geiger counter module by switching assigned mosfet

serial_manager.set_geiger_power_on()

! Reconnect power to geiger counter module by switching assigned mosfet

serial_manager.set_pm25_power_off()

! Disconnect power to PM25 sensor by switching assigned mosfet

serial_manager.set_pm25_power_on()

! Reconnect power to PM25 sensor by switching assigned mosfet

serial_manager.set_tsl_gain(new_gain)

! Set gain of TSL2591 vis/ir sensor

serial_manager.set_tsl_scl_connect()

! Reconnect the SCL signal for TSL2591 vis/ir sensor

serial_manager.set_tsl_scl_disconnect()

! Disconnect the SCL signal for TSL2591 vis/ir sensor
